summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional lieutenant, conducted on September 23, 2021, regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The lieutenant discusses the July 23, 2019 incident, the failure to assign Epstein a cellmate after his cellmate was transferred, the non-working cameras, and various procedural failures.

events.title: First Epstein Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found with a noose/rope in his cell with cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Treated as a possible suicide attempt. SIS investigation was inconclusive. Epstein placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cameras Discovered Not Working
events.description: The SIS lieutenant discovered the MCC camera system was not recording while trying to review footage with an associate warden. Notified Captain and wrote a memo. Technician said he would work overtime to fix it.

events.title: Reyes Transferred, Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (listed as WAB - With All Belongings). Epstein was left without a cellmate, contrary to psychological requirement. Multiple staff failures to notify supervisors and assign a new cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Unsecured Phone Call
events.description: Unit manager Nathaniel gave Epstein a phone call on an unsecured line in the SHU shower area. Epstein said he was calling his mother, but a male answered when the number was dialed. Call was not properly monitored or logged.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found deceased in his SHU cell. Lieutenant called in around 6:00 AM. Cell was taped off as a crime scene. FBI and OIG took over the investigation.

events.title: OIG Interview
events.description: DOJ OIG agents interview the BOP correctional lieutenant as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City
R&D (Receiving and Discharge) area at MCC
keyFacts: The lieutenant's investigation into the July 23, 2019 incident was inconclusive; Epstein denied trying to harm himself and said his cellmate did not harm him.

On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out (WAB), leaving Epstein without a cellmate despite a psychological requirement for him to have one. Multiple staff across shifts failed to notify supervisors or assign a new cellmate.

The MCC camera system stopped recording on July 29, 2019, and was not discovered until August 8, 2019. The lieutenant notified the captain and associate warden, but it was not fixed before Epstein's death.
Epstein was given an unsecured, unmonitored phone call by his unit manager on August 9, 2019, in violation of procedure.
The lieutenant believes systematic failures—specifically the lack of a cellmate and failure to conduct proper counts and rounds—were key factors that allowed Epstein to take his own life.
